channel.title: [Delta] Deleting doors!
channel.description:
Hey guys!
So one of the absolute most annoying things on a delta source is doors they aren't exactly on tiles more in between them so the ordinary [code] deletethatobject(X coord, Y coord); [/code]
Just Absolutely failed and hours of searching these forums proved fruitless for finding a solution, but in the end "lostmyphat" helped me out with this code, so the idea is you replace the door with an invisible object! So you can pass through it and you don't see it.
So you first find "public void NewObjects()" In this Public void should be thing like [code]makeGlobalObject(3568, 9699, 7315, 0, 10);//cw[/code]
So you just plonk right in there
makeGlobalObject(x Coord, Ycoord, 6951, -1, 0);
With 6951 being your invisible object, this replaces your door.
Finding the co ord for my door was rather tricky but in the end it turns out if I clicked on my door it came up with: [client-1- Username: atObject: 2758,3482 objectID: 1558 [client-1-Owner beast]: atObject: x co ord,y co ord objectID: 1558
99% credits to lostmyphat 1% credits to me!

item.title: [Delta] Deleting doors!
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Or just keep the doors open all the time.

item.title: [Delta] Deleting doors!
item.dc:creator: @looted_y00 looted y00
item.description:
@looted_y00 wrote:

I am doing a cammy pvp remake and wanted rid of the party room doors, no for them to open but thanks for the constructive criticism

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Deleting doors!
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

looted y00:

Doors.cfg and doorhandler are really hard and annoying to use on some delta sources, so its easier for new players to just get rid of them.

Add that PI tutorial for doors and doubledoors,
it works perfectly for delta too, apart from a very few modifications

Read full topic

Exactly, but why don’t you just make the door actually open instead of deleting it?

item.title: [Delta] Deleting doors!
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

deletethatobject(X coord, Y coord);
Doesn’t fail, you just have to add the object coordinates in it and not the tile ones

Read full topic
